tag_list: brazil, brasil, startups, seed-capital, initial-capital, israel, venture
overview:
Daniel is a founding partner at Initial Capital, responsible for operations in Brazil. His background combines extensive experience as advisor, senior manager and entrepreneur.

For the past 10 years Daniel has been a partner at DealMaker (www.dealmaker.com.br), a leading Investment & Management advisory firm in Brazil, where he has been involved with mergers & acquisitions, capital raising, IPOs and corporate restructuring for companies across several segments and sizes.

Daniel has a long history in IT, Telecommunications and Internet. Between 2009 / 2010, he was CEO at Softcorp, a leading systems integrator in Brazil, where he was responsible for the company’s strategic realignment, and where he remains as a Board Member. At DealMaker, he has consulted for a variety of companies in these segments over the past years, with particular emphasis on market analyses, product development and capital structuring. Previously to DealMaker, Daniel was an executive at the start-up of .comDominio Data Centers, currently a part of Equinix, and Brasil Telecom, where he was responsaible for new businesses and participated in several internet related initiatives. Daniel is also a shareholder and Board Member at ISPM, a leading provider of performance and service level management solutions in Brazil.
